metadata.Title: CVE-2019-0148 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
Resource leak in i40e driver for Intel(R) Ethernet 700 Series Controllersversions before 7.0 may allow an authenticated user to potentially enable adenial of service via local access.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-0148` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-198-generic - 4.4.0-198.230
linux-image-4.4.0-198-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-198.230
linux-image-4.4.0-198-lowlatency - 4.4.0-198.230
linux-image-4.4.0-198-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-198.230
linux-image-4.4.0-198-powerpc-smp - 4.4.0-198.230
linux-image-4.4.0-198-powerpc64-emb - 4.4.0-198.230
linux-image-4.4.0-198-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-198.230
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-198-generic - 4.4.0-198.230
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-198-lowlatency - 4.4.0-198.230
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-118-generic - 4.15.0-118.119~16.04.1
linux-image-4.15.0-118-generic-lpae - 4.15.0-118.119~16.04.1
linux-image-4.15.0-118-lowlatency - 4.15.0-118.119~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-118-generic - 4.15.0-118.119~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-118-lowlatency - 4.15.0-118.119~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1085-kvm - 4.4.0-1085.94
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1119-aws - 4.4.0-1119.133
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1083-aws - 4.15.0-1083.87~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1096-azure - 4.15.0-1096.106~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1084-gcp - 4.15.0-1084.95~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1054-oracle - 4.15.0-1054.58~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1143-raspi2 - 4.4.0-1143.153
No subscription required

No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-198.230').
linux-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-118.119~16.04.1').
linux-kvm package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1085.94').
linux-aws package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1119.133').
linux-aws-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1083.87~16.04.1').
linux-azure package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1096.106~16.04.1').
linux-gcp package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1084.95~16.04.1').
linux-oracle package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1054.58~16.04.1').
linux-oem: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
linux-raspi2 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1143.153').
linux-snapdragon package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1147.157').
